author: 星洲网
title: 美国洛杉矶一隧道坍塌 31名工人全部获救 - 国际 - 即时国际
text:
美国洛杉矶一隧道坍塌 31名工人全部获救
close
zoom
image
美国洛杉矶一隧道坍塌 31名工人全部获救
（洛杉矶10日综合电）美国加利福尼亚州洛杉矶市周三发生一起隧道坍塌事故，31名工人全部获救。
洛杉矶市消防局9日晚间发布的消息说，工人受困在位于威尔明顿地区的一处工业隧道。
ADVERTISEMENT
路透社引述消防局声明说，坍塌事故发生在隧道唯一入口以南约10公里处，隧道直径为5.5公尺，是为市政府的污水处理系统而建。
市政府派出100多名救援人员赶往现场。市长巴斯在社交媒体X发布的一篇帖子中说：“洛杉矶市已调动所有资源应对威尔明顿隧道坍塌事故。”
巴斯后来说：“所有受困在威尔明顿隧道中的工人现已获救，并确认下落。我刚刚与许多受困工人进行了交谈。感谢所有立即采取行动的英勇救急人员。”

author: VNExplorer
title: Scientists Discovered Something Kinda Alarming: The Universe Shouldn't Actually Exist
text: Scientists argue that primordial black holes should have caused the Higgs field to collapse, preventing the universe's formation, challenging current models. The universe is permeated by a field known as the Higgs field, which gives everything its mass. But the Higgs field isn’t entirely stable, and if it were to “bubble,” it would change reality to such a degree that everything in that “bubble” would cease to exist. A team of scientists has now argued that the existence of primordial black holes should have triggered the “bubbling” of the Higgs field to such a degree that nothing should have ever been able to form. The earliest days of the universe are shrouded in mystery. After all, it’s not like we can just pop back in time and check it out for ourselves. Instead, we’re restricted to piecing together our cosmos’s earliest history from hints, echoes, and faded waves propagating out into the infinite. As a result, the models we create of these earliest times are often called into question by new math or physical observations that challenge the pieces we’ve put in place so far. And recently, a team of physicists did just that. According to their new study—now accepted for publication in the journal Physical Letters B—if many of our current models are correct, we wouldn’t exist at all. Nothing would. As things stand now, the whole universe should have annihilated itself. But, obviously, the universe has not annihilated itself. After all, we’re here to ask all these probing questions. So, what gives? It all comes down to two objects: primordial black holes and the Higgs boson particle. The 2012 discovery of the Higgs boson is widely considered one of the great triumphs of modern physics. This is largely because it confirmed the existence of the Higgs field—a field much like electricity or magnetism that literally gives objects their mass. It’s complicated quantum mechanics, but it all boils down to this: if there’s no Higgs field, nothing exists at all. All this to say that the Higgs field is incredibly important, and it’s incredibly important as it is. Because here’s a fun fact that isn’t existentially terrifying at all—theoretically, the Higgs field could change. “The Higgs field isn’t likely to be in the lowest possible energy state it could be in,” Lucien Heurtier, one of the researchers on the new study, said in an article for The Conversation. “That means it could theoretically change its state, dropping to a lower energy state in a certain location. If that happened, however, it would alter the laws of physics dramatically.” Basically, Heurtier explained that if the Higgs field were to drop to a lower energy state, it would cause the formation of little “bubbles” of space that were subject to entirely different rules of physics than the universe as we know it. “In such a bubble,” he wrote, “the mass of electrons would suddenly change, and so would its interactions with other particles. Protons and neutrons—which make up the atomic nucleus and are made of quarks—would suddenly dislocate. Essentially, anybody experiencing such a change would likely no longer be able to report it.” Luckily, that’s not going to happen any time soon—no need to panic. But the idea introduces a problem. In many of our existing models of the early universe, that actually should have happened already. And that’s because of object two: the primordial black hole. Primordial black holes are hypothetical objects much like the black holes we see today, but orders of magnitude smaller in mass—they could be as small as a gram. According to many current models, they formed in the second right after the Big Bang, during an era known as inflation. Regions of the universe were so dense at that time that they would have been able to collapse in on themselves and form these teeny tiny black holes without the aid of a supernova. Just… shwoomp! Right into a black hole. Now, these things—if they ever existed—were short-lived. They would have burned hot and evaporated away pretty dang quickly. But according to Heurtier and his team, they would have been around long enough to have an incredibly powerful impact on the Higgs field. Those bubbles that we mentioned earlier? The universe-shattering ones? Yeah, primordial black holes should have caused them to appear all over the place. The research team asserts that if primordial black holes existed during this early period of inflation as many current models suggest, the field would have been bubbling away like a shaken can of soda. So much so, in fact, that nothing should have ever been able to form in the first place. But we exist, as does everything around us. So, where does that leave us? Heurtier and his team propose two responses to this news. The first is that our models are wrong, and that we should discard the idea of primordial black holes altogether. After all, we know for sure that the Higgs field exists, so if there’s a problem, it must lie in the primordial black holes. Right? Well, not definitely. The other scenario posed by the group is that we are missing serious physics—namely, that there is something big that we don’t understand about the way the Higgs field works. That’s often an option in particularly high-level physics—maybe there’s just some law or behavior or force or particle we don’t know about yet that will crack the whole thing wide open. Certainly, this will not be the last team to investigate the theoretical interactions between the Higgs field and primordial black holes. Maybe this new understanding will stand, and maybe it won’t. But that’s the best part of science—you can, and should, question everything. Who knows what mysteries you’ll unlock?

author: advfn.com
title: HiringThing Enhances Applicant Tracking System with AI Pay Rate Feature
text:
New ATS Feature Delivers Real-Time, Market-Aligned Compensation Recommendations for Smarter, Faster Hiring Decisions
BARTONSVILLE, Pa. , Feb. 27, 2025 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- HiringThing, the leader in white label recruiting and employee onboarding solutions, today announced the launch of its AI Pay Rate feature, the latest enhancement to its evolving applicant tracking system (ATS) platform. This innovative feature empowers employers with data-driven pay rate recommendations, streamlining the hiring process and ensuring competitive compensation offers.
"By providing real-time, market-aligned pay rate recommendations based on job details, our latest enhancement helps employers attract top talent faster and with greater confidence." "We designed AI Pay Rate to take the guesswork out of setting pay ranges," said Joshua Siler , CEO at HiringThing. "By providing real-time, market-aligned pay rate recommendations based on job details, our latest enhancement helps employers attract top talent faster and with greater confidence."
This enhancement reflects HiringThing's commitment to providing cutting-edge technology that addresses the evolving needs of HR professionals. By automating critical aspects of compensation analysis, AI Pay Rate helps employers remain competitive in today's fast-paced hiring landscape.
Additionally, AI Pay Rate enhances the platform's value for private label channel partners, enabling them to offer a more advanced, competitive ATS solution to their clients. This feature helps partners differentiate their offerings by providing market-driven pay insights that streamline hiring processes. Users can access and try the new AI Pay Rate generator directly within their ATS accounts today.
About HiringThing
HiringThing is a modern recruiting platform as a service that creates seamless hiring experiences. Our white label applicant tracking system, employee onboarding and open API enable technology and service providers to embed hiring capabilities from sourcing to onboarding. Approachable and adaptable, the platform empowers anyone, anywhere, to hire their dream team. For more information, visit hiringthing.com or follow us on LinkedIn, X, or YouTube.
Media Contact
Joanna Campa , HiringThing, 1 8887692023, marketing@hiringthing.com, hiringthing.com
View original content:https://www.prweb.com/releases/hiringthing-enhances-applicant-tracking-system-with-ai-pay-rate-feature-302387045.html

author: @actufrmarseille
title: Canicule à Marseille : une nuit étouffante arrive, 27 degrés sont annoncés | Actu Marseille
text:
Voir mon actu Suivre Actu Marseille Alors que le premier épisode de canicule de l’année 2024 s’est produit cette semaine sur une grande partie de la France, Marseille n’est pas forcément au bout de ses peines.
Durant la nuit du samedi 3 au dimanche 4 août, les températures seront, en effet, très élevées la nuit. Voici plus de détails.
À lire aussi
Canicule. L’alerte orange à Marseille arrive-t-elle trop tard ? « Un sujet tabou »
27 degrés dans la nuit à Marseille Si le thermomètre ne devrait pas dépasser, au maximum, les 33 degrés durant ce week-end, la nuit de samedi à dimanche s’annonce cependant brûlante dans la cité phocéenne. Selon les prévisions actuelles de Météo France , 27 degrés sont en effet annoncés.
Dans le jargon météorologique, une nuit qui ne descend jamais en dessous des 20 degrés est d’ailleurs appelée une nuit tropicale .
D’autres villes concernées dans le département Toujours selon les prévisionnistes, d’autres villes auront droit à une chaude nuit, entre samedi et dimanche, dans le département.
Vidéos : en ce moment sur Actu Ce sera le cas à Istres, à Port-Saint-Louis et aux Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer, avec 26 degrés au compteur. La nuit suivante, à savoir celle de dimanche à lundi, les tendances devraient être les mêmes, à un degré de moins près.
Sur le site de Météo France, les températures sont annoncées brûlantes durant la nuit de samedi à dimanche. (©Capture d’écran / Site de Météo France) En début de semaine, la nuit de lundi à mardi avait été éprouvante pour les Azuréens : la température n’était pas descendue en dessous de la barre des 27,4 degrés à Nice, 27,8 degrés à Menton.
Suivez toute l’actualité de vos villes et médias favoris en vous inscrivant à Mon Actu .
#Canicule #Météo France

author: Hannah Mose
title: McLaren Bay Region workforce ‘affected’ due to service consolidation
text: McLaren Bay Region workforce ‘affected’ due to service consolidation BAY CO., Mich. (WNEM) – McLaren Bay Region said it made a decision to consolidate some services and team members, which has affected its workforce. The hospital said, after careful consideration, it decided to consolidate its endoscopy services and team members. The Geriatric Psychiatry department has also been consolidated into the Adult Inpatient Behavioral Health Unit. “Our workforce has been affected, and every effort has been made to redeploy as many team members as possible,” McLaren Bay Region said in a statement to TV5. When asked, a representative for McLaren would not specify how many team members are affected. The hospital said it is not immune to the changes affecting the health care industry, including supply and labor costs, unfavorable reimbursement environments, and declines in service line use and patient admissions. McLaren said these consolidations have enhanced the hospital’s ability to operate more efficiently while continuing to serve the community. You can read McLaren’s full statement below: McLaren Bay Region has not been immune to the transformational changes affecting the global health care industry over the past several years including unprecedented supply and labor costs, unfavorable reimbursement environment, as well as declines in service line use and patient admissions. Though, with the efficient utilization of staff and optimization of resources, the communities McLaren Bay Region serves will continue to benefit from a wide array of health care services offered. Following careful consideration, the decision was made to consolidate endoscopy services and team members to within the hospital. Additionally, the dedicated Geriatric Psychiatry department has been consolidated into the Adult Inpatient Behavioral Health Unit, where patients will still receive specialized care.Our workforce has been affected, and every effort has been made to redeploy as many team members as possible. McLaren Bay Region’s commitment to providing high-quality, lifesaving health care to the community remains in full force, and with these rightsizing efforts, we have enhanced our ability to operate more efficiently and continue to support the communities we are privileged to serve. Hailey Olsick, the president of the RN union at McLaren Bay Hospital, issued the following statement: “SEIU leadership has been working with McLaren administrators to limit layoffs, maintain safe staffing levels, and provide high quality care. Unfortunately, several of our nurses were impacted by the layoffs. We want the community to know that if they come to McLaren Bay, they will continue to receive the same high quality standard of care. Our nurses strive hard every day to ensure that the needs of our community come first.” The union said it is unclear how many nurses are impacted as it is an ongoing issue. Subscribe to the [TV5 newsletter](https://www.wnem.com/newsletter/) and receive the latest local news and weather straight to your email every day. Copyright 2024 WNEM. All rights reserved.

author: 鉅亨網新聞中心
title: 盤中速報 - 泓格(3577)大漲7.1%，報98元
text:
盤中速報 - 泓格(3577)大漲7.1%，報98元
鉅亨網新聞中心
泓格(3577-TW)31日10:15股價上漲6.5元，報98.0元，漲幅7.1%，成交1,326張。
泓格(3577-TW)所屬產業為電腦及週邊設備業，主要業務為產業電腦相關產品研發、製造銷售及電腦軟體代理買賣。遠端控制器之研發、製造銷售、維修及相關材料進出口業務。工控介面卡之研發、製造銷售、維修及相關材料進出口業務。
近5日股價下跌9.85%，櫃買市場加權指數下跌0.31%，短期股價無明顯表現。

author: Mariana Sánchez
title: No consumas almendras si sufres alguna de estas condiciones; cuida tu salud esta temporada
text:
Cuando elegimos los alimentos que vamos a consumir debemos de priorizar que nos aporten nutrientes beneficiosos para nuestra salud . Estos nutrientes deben poder satisfacer nuestras necesidades energéticas, estructurales, funcionales y reguladoras, precisa la Sociedad Española de Gastroenterología, Hepatología y Nutrición Pediátrica.
Advertencia sobre las almendras. Fuente: Freepik Sus expertos afirman que entre los alimentos más recomendados se encuentran los frutos secos ya que son una fuente importante de proteínas , grasas insaturadas, fibra, calcio, magnesio, fósforo, potasio y vitaminas E y del grupo B. Además, aconsejan el consumo de una a cinco raciones por semana.
Leer más: Si deseas una piel más firme, esta fruta es tu mejor opción; descubre todos sus beneficios
Advertencia sobre las almendras Desde la Fundación Española del Corazón indican que los frutos secos son una buena alternativa a las proteínas animales, se pueden incluir en el desayuno o en las comidas, pero hay que evitar consumirlos en grandes cantidades por su mala digestibilidad y su elevado aporte calórico. En este punto especifica que una ración de este alimento la forman entre 20 y 30 gramos de frutos.
Advertencia sobre las almendras. Fuente: Freepik Entre los frutos secos más recomendados están las almendras que se caracterizan proteínas, ácidos grasos monoinsaturados, ácidos grasos insaturados , fibra, calcio, fósforo, magnesio, hierro, zinc, potasio, vitamina E , riboflavina, tiamina, niacina y folatos, según datos de la Fundación Española de la Nutrición.
Leer más: Piel más joven; descubre los beneficios de este alimento y por qué ayuda a estimular el colágeno
Más allá de que todos los nutrientes que contienen las almendras impactan positivamente en el cuidado de la salud general, se trata de un alimento que no es apto para todas las personas. A continuación te contamos quiénes deberían evitar su consumo.
Problemas digestivos : si son consumidas en exceso podrían causar problemas gastrointestinales debido a su contenido de fibra. Alergias: algunas personas pueden ser alérgicas a este fruto seco. Gran aporte de calorías: quienes buscan bajar de peso o están realizando una dieta en particular deberían evitarlas porque aportan un alto contenido en grasas saludables. Adiós a los ronquidos molestos; descubre las propiedades que tiene esta hierba antes de dormir
Únete a nuestro canal ¡EL UNIVERSAL ya está en Whatsapp!, desde tu dispositivo móvil entérate de las noticias más relevantes del día, artículos de opinión, entretenimiento, tendencias y más.

author: 蕃新聞
title: 企業主與投資人的必修課！臺大「財務報表分析研習班」招生中
text:
企業主與投資人的必修課！臺大「財務報表分析研習班」招生中
中央社/
1 小時前
(中央社訊息服務20250612 14:10:10)臺大進修推廣學院將自114年7月8日起每週二晚間開辦「財務報表分析研習班」，由臺大國際企業系所林修葳教授親自授課，課程介紹包括資產負債表、企業財務分析差異、綜合損益表、現金流量表、資產運用效率指標、投資報酬率指標、市場風險計測等，並藉由臺灣、中國與美國等地的企業會計報表解說及個案導讀，建立學員對財務報表的完整認識。讓您不再對公司財務營運狀況分析文件感覺鴨子聽雷，猶如霧裡看花。
財務報表分析課程讓您學習深入瞭解財務數據、提高風險管理能力，並優化資本配置，瞭解財務報表的數據和指標是分析公司財務健康的基礎，有助於做出明智的商業決策，您也可以更好地識別潛在的風險，以採取適當的措施來減輕風險，同時，幫助您更有效地分配資本和資源，以實現企業的戰略目標，有助提高效益和業績，這對於企業經營者和投資者來說至關重要。
企業之經營形態與成果，除了由經濟媒體得知外，最重要的莫過於了解其所公佈之財務報表了。財務報表反映企業的財政表現，能幫助投資者和債權人了解企業的經營狀況，進一步幫助經濟決策。對投資者來說，能夠分析公司的財務報表是做出投資決策的關鍵，學習財務報表分析課程有助於選擇有潛力的投資機會，減少風險。
凡對財務報表分析感興趣者皆可報名參加。即日起開始受理報名，114年6月17日前完成報名繳費者還可享有學費優惠。歡迎上臺大推廣教育網或致電(02)2362-0502臺大進修推廣學院查詢。
「財務報表分析研習班」https://reurl.cc/zqQXZe

author: Dossier réalisé par Frédéric Joly (frederic.joly@lebienpublic.fr)
title: Harcèlement moral et agressions sexuelles présumés à l'université. Un enseignant-chercheur du campus de Dijon suspendu cinq ans
text: Harcèlement moral et agressions sexuelles présumés à l'université Un enseignant-chercheur du campus de Dijon suspendu cinq ans Un universitaire brillant, unanimement reconnu par ses pairs pour ses qualités scientifiques, mais lesté depuis de nombreuses années des doutes persistants sur ses relations humaines, notamment avec ses étudiantes. Par décision de la section disciplinaire du conseil académique compétente à l’égard des enseignants-chercheurs, en date du lundi 27 novembre, Frank Cézilly (1), enseignant-chercheur au [laboratoire Biogéosciences de l’université de Bourgogne](https://biogeosciences.u-bourgogne.fr/) , est « interdit d’exercer toutes fonctions d’enseignement ou de recherche ou certaines d’entre elles dans tout établissement public d’enseignement supérieur pendant cinq ans, avec privation de la totalité du traitement ». Une sanction lourde, inédite à l’université de Bourgogne, et très élevée dans le barème des sanctions possibles pour un enseignant-chercheur : au-delà, il y a seulement la mise en retraite d’office et la révocation.
